\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 68263}

\subsection*{Binge Nearly Kills Me}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Joe}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 10 glasses & oral & Alcohol - Beer/Wine & liquid\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 3 glasses & oral & Alcohol - Beer/Wine & liquid\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 3 shots & oral & Alcohol - Hard & liquid\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 1 shot & oral & Alcohol - Hard & liquid\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 1 shot & oral & Alcohol - Hard & liquid\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 230.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
 \#\#EROWID\_NOTE:UNCONFIRMED\_INJURY\_REPORT\#\# 



One large bottle of barefoot Merlot, three bass ales, three shots of Jameson, one shot of Jagermeister, one shot of goldschlager, put me in the ER for gastritis.  I was unconscious and vomiting for about 16 hours.  When I woke, I just could not stop vomiting and hiccuping.  I went to the ER eventually.  The doc told me I'd burned away the inner layer of my stomach.  I couldn't eat solid food for a week.  The hiccups left a sharp pain in my solar plexus every time I swallowed.



After this experience my sleeping schedule reversed so that I was up all night and asleep during the day.  I ended up on Zoloft and mood stabilizers after this experience.  I took them for about a year while abstaining from alcohol.  They worked.

I just got off the Zoloft recently and had my first drink in about a year.  I never drink more than one drink in one day now.  That is my new rule.  If I break it, I'm done.  I never want to go through that experience again.  I nearly died from that experience.

\end{document}
